intro: Wilkiea rigidifolia, commonly known as the rigid leaf wilkiea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, narrow lance-shaped leaves, and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is well adapted to sandy soils and salt-laden environments. Wilkiea rigidifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
